page.title: 04CUSTOMS: SWANSEA WEST
page.content: Although the area is predominantly English speaking, some Welsh customs still prevail,e.g. the celebration of St. David's Day. On March 1, little girls dress traditional Welsh costumes. Schools hold Eisteddfodau or concerts where children compete against each other in music,recitation and dance. Schools close for half a day to celebrate the saint's day. In Singleton Park, there is a Gorsedd circle, which is a circle of very large stones. This is used for the ceremony to proclaim the National Eisteddfod in the year before it is held. It is also used during Eisteddfod week when new members are accepted into the Gorsedd. The National Eisteddfod has been held in Swansea on three occasions, most recently in 1982.
